entry.title: Linda Liukas - What every girl needs to know about programming
entry.content:
Highlights:

  • The low number of girls and women in programming is a systematic problem, something fundamental is missing
  • Teenage girls have a massive amount of crazy and creative energy, they should learn to code
  • Coding is not lonely and it's not mathematical
  • We are so stuck in semantics and exclusion that we can't function as a community, it's no longer fun and enjoyable
  • It's up to us to create a new culture of development - one that is fun and focuses on creating and building

My thoughts:

Linda Liukas thank you, thank you, thank you.

Right now (in technology) girls are rewarded when they fit in with the boys, but what about the girls don't and just want to be themselves? The outlets for them are few and far between.

Not convinced? Try thinking about it this way:

There are many girls/women frustrated by their experiences in programming, but men are not equally as frustrated. This means it's not the same situation.

What can we do to help?

  • Girls need technological role models (how many female Mark Zuckerbergs can you think of?)
  • Support organizations that make learning about technology fun
  • End unprofessional behavior in your workplace (RTFM shaming, sexual/objectifying images or conversations, demeaning jokes).
  • Talk with a young person about how fun and amazing it is to build web products with wonderful people all day.

If I should ever have a daughter or a son I would like them to see the world of technology through this lens of magical and radiant culture.

Linda Liukas What Every Girl Needs to Know About Programming

Please check out Rails Girls, and Linda - thank you.
